title: Inverse Matrix Method for Linear Systems Quiz
description: Test your understanding of solving linear systems using matrix inversion.

questions.question: What is the solution to AX = B using the inverse method?
questions.explanation: X = A⁻¹B is the matrix inverse method.

questions.question: When can the inverse matrix method be used?
options: When B is a column vector
questions.explanation: The method requires A to be invertible (square and det ≠ 0).

questions.question: What is the advantage of the inverse matrix method?
options: Is always faster than Gauss elimination
questions.explanation: The method gives exact symbolic solutions.

questions.question: How many equations and variables are needed?
options: Equal number of equations and variables
questions.explanation: The method requires a square coefficient matrix.

questions.question: What should you check first?
questions.explanation: First verify that the coefficient matrix is invertible.
